com.android.layoutlib.bridge.impl

Class GcSnapshot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.android.layoutlib.bridge.impl.GcSnapshot

  • public class GcSnapshot
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a graphics context snapshot, as well as a context stack as a linked list.

    This is based on top of Graphics2D but can operate independently if none are available yet when setting transforms and clip information.

    This allows for drawing through #draw(Drawable, Paint_Delegate) and #draw(Drawable, Paint_Delegate) Handling of layers (created with Canvas.saveLayer(RectF, Paint, int)) is handled through a list of Graphics2D for each layers. The class actually maintains a list of Layer for each layer. Doing a save() will duplicate this list so that each graphics2D object (Layer#getGraphics()) is configured only for the new snapshot.

    • Method Detail

      • createDefaultSnapshot

        public static GcSnapshot createDefaultSnapshot(android.graphics.Bitmap_Delegate bitmap)
        Creates the root snapshot associating it with a given bitmap.

        If bitmap is null, then setBitmap(Bitmap_Delegate) must be called before the snapshot can be used to draw. Transform and clip operations are permitted before.

        Parameters:
        image - the image to associate to the snapshot or null.
        Returns:
        the root snapshot

      • save

        public GcSnapshot save(int flags)
        Saves the current state according to the given flags and returns the new current snapshot.

        This is the equivalent of Canvas.save(int)

        Parameters:
        flags - the save flags.
        Returns:
        the new snapshot
        See Also:
        Canvas.save(int)

      • saveLayer

        public GcSnapshot saveLayer(android.graphics.RectF layerBounds,
                            android.graphics.Paint_Delegate paint,
                            int flags)
        Saves the current state and creates a new layer, and returns the new current snapshot.

        This is the equivalent of Canvas.saveLayer(RectF, Paint, int)

        Parameters:
        layerBounds - the layer bounds
        paint - the Paint information used to blit the layer back into the layers underneath upon restore
        flags - the save flags.
        Returns:
        the new snapshot
        See Also:
        Canvas.saveLayer(RectF, Paint, int)

      • dispose

        public void dispose()

      • restore

        public GcSnapshot restore()
        Restores the top GcSnapshot, and returns the next one.

      • restoreTo

        public GcSnapshot restoreTo(int saveCount)
        Restores the GcSnapshot to saveCount.
        Parameters:
        saveCount - the saveCount or -1 to only restore 1.
        Returns:
        the new head of the Gc snapshot stack.

      • size

        public int size()

      • setBitmap

        public void setBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap_Delegate bitmap)
        Link the snapshot to a Bitmap_Delegate.

        This is only for the case where the snapshot was created with a null image when calling createDefaultSnapshot(Bitmap_Delegate), and is therefore not yet linked to a previous snapshot.

        If any transform or clip information was set before, they are put into the Graphics object.

        Parameters:
        bitmap - the bitmap to link to.

      • draw

        public void draw(GcSnapshot.Drawable drawable)
        Executes the Drawable's draw method, with a null paint delegate.

        Note that the method can be called several times if there are more than one active layer.

        Parameters:
        drawable -

      • draw

        public void draw(GcSnapshot.Drawable drawable,
                 android.graphics.Paint_Delegate paint,
                 boolean compositeOnly,
                 boolean forceSrcMode)
        Executes the Drawable's draw method.

        Note that the method can be called several times if there are more than one active layer.

        Parameters:
        drawable -
        paint -
        compositeOnly - whether the paint is used for composite only. This is typically the case for bitmaps.
        forceSrcMode - if true, this overrides the composite to be SRC
